segments.text: I'm looking at this kitchen, and the mess is just growing by the second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That sink has been overflowing for what seems like ages now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is surely seeping into the wooden cabinets and causing real damage.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's such an avoidable disaster, simply by turning a tap.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The thought of water damage and warped wood is genuinely unpleasant.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the woman just stands there, perfectly serene, polishing a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her obliviousness is almost unbelievable, it's quite frustrating to witness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children's antics, while risky, pale in comparison to the water havoc.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene feels a bit absurd, like a slow-motion catastrophe.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can practically smell the damp wood and the mildew already.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It really gets under my skin to see such a preventable situation unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone needs to step in and halt this cascade of domestic woe.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast with the calm garden outside makes the internal disarray even more stark.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to grab the faucet and twist it shut myself.
segments.speaker: PAR
